intro: Leucopsora leucantha, commonly known as the white leek, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has finely divided, grass-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its elegant foliage and delicate blooms. Leucopsora leucantha prefers moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in woodland or meadow habitats.
